page.title: 17TEENAGE GIRLS LEISURE TIME
page.content: Michelle:- My friends and I spend very little of our spare time at home; after school we have tea, do our homework, perhaps watch television for half an hour and then go out. Once or twice a week, whenever we can afford it we go to discos in Bradford such as Dollars or Blue Lace, where we listen to the music, chat and drink lager. There are always more boys than girls but few people get up to dance until late in the evening. When we don't go to discos we walk around the estate with our friends or go down to the Interchange in Bradford and hang about in groups. We haven't any hobbies but we all have weekend jobs such as stacking shelves in the supermarkets or helping to shampoo at the local hairdressers. Our parents expect us to provide our pocket money.
